books.author: by Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.
books.name: TALKING TO STRANGERS

books.author: by Jim Mattis and Bing West
books.description: The former Marine infantry officer and secretary of defense recounts key moments from his career and imparts his leadership philosophy.
books.name: CALL SIGN CHAOS

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by Garrett M. Graff
books.description: An oral history of the events that occurred on Sept. 11, 2001, based on transcripts, declassified documents and interviews.
books.name: THE ONLY PLANE IN THE SKY

books.author: by Jodi Kantor and Megan Twohey
books.description: Two reporters for The New York Times recount their investigation into Harvey Weinstein’s alleged abuses of power and the subsequent global disclosure of women’s traumatic stories.
books.name: SHE SAID

books.author: by Samantha Power
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning author's journey from being an immigrant to being an activist outsider to serving in President Obama’s cabinet.
books.name: THE EDUCATION OF AN IDEALIST

books.author: by Randall Munroe
books.description: The former NASA roboticist dispenses complex and excessive solutions to common problems; reclassified this week as nonfiction.
books.name: HOW TO

books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by David A. Sinclair and Matthew D. LaPlante
books.description: A professor of genetics at Harvard Medical School expounds on some new technologies and lifestyle changes that may affect aging.
books.name: LIFESPAN

books.author: by Caitlin Doughty
books.description: A funeral director answers 35 questions from children about death.
books.name: WILL MY CAT EAT MY EYEBALLS?

books.author: by Lisa Taddeo
books.description: The inequality of female desire is explored through the sex lives of a homemaker, a high school student and a restaurant owner.
books.name: THREE WOMEN

books.author: by Jeanine Pirro
books.description: The Fox News host posits those she labels anti-Trump conspirators have committed possible crimes and a plot to destroy liberty.
books.name: RADICALS, RESISTANCE AND REVENGE

books.author: by Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”
books.name: BORN A CRIME

books.author: by Michelle Malkin
books.description: The conservative syndicated columnist blames liberals and Silicon Valley for what she calls an immigration crisis.
books.name: OPEN BORDERS INC.

books.author: by Sean Carroll
books.description: The theoretical physicist puts forward the theory that there is more than one of us in the universe.
books.name: SOMETHING DEEPLY HIDDEN
